oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Midgett Chapel UM Church: facade
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of Midgett Chapel UM Church. The church is a concrete-block, gable-front building with circa 1960 brick veneer on the facade. Double-hung, sash windows flank the double-doored front entrance. An ornate, wrought iron sign sits in front of the church. The sign reads, "Midgett Chapel United Methodist Church; Minister: Rev. Tommy E. Love."

Midgett Chapel United Methodist Church is a rural African American church in Alamo, Tennessee. The current building features brick veneer from 1960 and original windows, circa 1920. A earlier segregated elementary school is located behind the church. At the time of fieldwork, Reverend Tommy L. Love served as minister.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee
